millsfield:images_texts:
TWA's COMMITMENT
The most comfortable fleet
of planes in the world.
TWA

RECEIVED
TWA
AMBASSADOR
Contact
Vol. II, No. 2
End of Summer 1972
A PRIVATELY CIRCULATED NEWSLETTER TO IMPORTANT BUSINESS TRAVELERS
A MESSAGE FROM TWA'S PRESIDENT
The only way TWA can continue to merit your busi-
ness is to continue to improve our services. This news-
letter and the enclosed "Commitment" folder discuss
some of our efforts.
We have now completely refurbished 90% of our en-
tire U.S. and international fleet. On nearly every
TWA plane you'll find new colors, carpets and fabrics.
New, overstuffed seats in first class, and our exclusive
Twin Seat in coach.
You'll find coach lounges on most of our longer U.S.
flights, and carry-on luggage compartments on most
shorter ones.
We are continuing the expansion of both of our pre-
mier flight services: Ambassador Service for long
flights, Ambassador Express for the shorter ones, so
that more people in more cities can enjoy them.
The introduction of a new aircraft is always exciting
for an airline, and our L-1011 makes this especially
true. This issue tells you about it, from both a pas-
senger's and pilot's point of view.
These innovations are part of TWA's commitment to
give you the finest service and most comfortable fleet
of planes in the world.
FCWiSEr
F. C. WISER
"OUR PASSENGERS TOLD US WHAT THEY
LOOK FOR IN THE 'IDEAL' AIRCRAFT, AND
WE'RE DELIVERING IT IN THE L-1011."
BLAINE COOKE
Senior Vice President of Marketing
In many ways TWA's new L-1011, the newest addi-
tion to our Ambassador Service fleet, resembles a
check list of the features passengers have asked for
or been enthusiastic about on our other aircraft.
This $17.5 million jet, unquestionably the most mod-
ern plane in the world, has the spaciousness of our
747's. Nine feet separates floor and ceiling. Built to
hold a potential capacity of 250 passengers, the L-1011
has been limited by TWA to a seating capacity of 206
to enhance this spaciousness.
It has first class and coach lounges like our 747's and
707's. And carry-on luggage compartments like our
727's, so that you can bring even a full-size suitcase
right on board with you.
Two-Across Coach Seating
There is two-across seating throughout the coach sec-
tion, so you are never more than one seat from the
aisle. Seat backs fold forward to form consoles, and
all armrests recess into seat backs.
All seats have
TWA's lumbar support system: at the touch of a but-
ton, cushions inflate to the contour of your back. The
coach seat on the L-1011 is the finest seat ever put in
coach on any airplane.
The coach lounge has a fully-equipped, stand-up bar,
and comfortable alcoves.
The entire first class section feels like a lounge. The
club chairs around tables swivel up to 270° to form
cocktail and dining areas. Soon, we'll serve dinner
for four in these dining areas.
All meals are prepared in an automated, below-deck
galley. From infra-red, high-speed ovens they go up-
stairs by special lifts to satellite service centers, and
are served individually by flight attendants.
Thus,
the L-1011 achieves the unique dual advantage of
keeping kitchen activity out of the cabins, and reduc-
ing the need for carts in the aisles.
The L-1011 has more space for the things you bring
on board with you, too. In addition to the carry-on
luggage compartments, there are self-locking over-
head storage compartments, and compartments for
coats and garment bags that disappear into the walls.
And everywhere you look, you'll find this wide cabin
immensely pleasing to the eye.
The colorful seat
fabrics and carpeting, and indirect lighting in the
honeycombed, sculptured ceiling, all add up to mak-
ing the L-1011 the most attractive, comfortable plane
you've ever flown.
Ambassador Service Featured
Almost every L-1011 flight will feature TWA's popu-
lar Ambassador Service. That means curbside bag-
gage check-in and gate area ticketing if you prefer,
and a Ground Ambassador in the departure lounge
to smooth boarding and make any last-minute travel
arrangements for you.
